titleStmt.title: The vviddoves mite cast into the treasure-house of the prerogatiues, and prayses of our B. Lady, the immaculate, and most glorious Virgin Mary, the Mother of God. With reasons why we are to haue great confidence in her prayers. Whereunto is annexed, A prayer, for the loue of God, made in contemplation of the passion of Christ our Sauiour.
titleStmt.author: A. G., fl. 1619.

titleStmt.title: The vviddoves mite cast into the treasure-house of the prerogatiues, and prayses of our B. Lady, the immaculate, and most glorious Virgin Mary, the Mother of God. With reasons why we are to haue great confidence in her prayers. Whereunto is annexed, A prayer, for the loue of God, made in contemplation of the passion of Christ our Sauiour.
titleStmt.author: A. G., fl. 1619.
Matthew, Tobie, Sir, 1577-1655, attributed name.

publicationStmt.date: Published by allowance of superiours. Anno M. DC. XIX. [1619]

notesStmt.note: Place of publication and press from STC.
"A prayer for the loue of God" is in verse; possibly by Sir Tobie Matthew.--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
